Hi,

>Well I actually started out by devising an indirect encoding based on a
>genome with a tree structure. What I realised was, that without
>something to compare against I couldn't determine if the technique was
>better than the more simple direct encodings out there.

It may not be better for simple problems.  I believe the judgement 
criterion for indirect coding will be addressing harder problems, not 
working better on the current ones.

>Actually, I don't know how others feel about this but I'm sometimes
>slightly baffled at just how underdevelped this areas of AI research is
>and that some of this work wasn't done years ago!

It's not just this area.  I think the problem is that to publish you have 
to implement and test, and implementation is far more time concerning than 
design, and testing is slower still.

         Ian Badcoe
